g-0: ^You are a recent high school graduate living in a small city apartment.
^You currently work at a clothing boutique.
g-1: ^You have a chronic illness and hidden disability.
^Balance your energy, health, and wellness to make it through the next two days.
g-2: ^Your life will save after each choice you make.
^There's no redo button, so please think carefully about your decisions.

introduction: ^There's a knock on the door. You're the only one home right now.

g-0: ^A mail carrier greets you. They politely ask for your signature and hand you an electronic device with a plastic stylus.
g-2: ^With a quick, "Thank you!" they hand over a large, thin envelope and return to their car. You close the door and return to the kitchen.
g-3: ^You open the package at the kitchen table and stare in awe at the final piece of the puzzle: your high school diploma.
g-4: ^Congratulations! You did it. You're officially an adult. At least, according to your parents' logic.
g-5: ^They both promised that once you graduated you could move out on your own, get a job, and prove your independence.
g-6: ^With no time to waste, you head to your room to grab a coat. Before rushing out the door, you take a moment to look at yourself in the hallway mirror.
g-8: ^That's better. You feel ready to head out into the world. Or, at least, to go to the local convenience store to grab a newspaper.
g-9: ^It's a bit old fashion, but you heard the best place to find apartments and jobs in the nearby city was in the newspaper classifieds.
g-10: ^Just as you're about to leave, you pause for a second to check-in with yourself. When you're excited, it's easy to lose track of how you're actually feeling.
g-11: ^. It reprents the general energy you have to accomplish tasks and exist in the world. If you run out of energy you can push yourself further, for a price. It is shown using a green color.
g-12: ^. It represents your physical health. The lower your health the sicker you feel. If you run out of Health you pass out. It is shown using a red color.
g-13: ^. It represents your mental wellness. The lower your wellness the worse you feel emotionally. If you run out of Wellness you pass out. It is shown using a blue color.
g-14: ^You can check-in with yourself at any time by viewing the Needs app in the menu. Or looking at the numbers in the top-right corner of the screen.
g-15: ^You're not feeling the best, but you should have enough energy to make it to the store and back.
g-16: ^You lock the door behind you and make your way to the local bus stop.

g-1: ^You lost 1 Energy from riding the bus.

g-3: ^After grabbing your medication, you take an extra minute to brush your teeth before letting your sense of smell guide you to the kitchen.
g-4: ^You lose 1 Energy from brushing your teeth.
g-5: ^Your mother is sitting at the table, while your father flips pancakes in a pan on the stove. Each flip sends another wave of the sweet smell in your direction.
g-6: ^Your mother lightly taps the diploma you left on the table yesterday to get your attention.
g-7: ^! We're both so proud of you!"

c-9: ^"You're welcome. I know things haven't been easy, especially with your doctors still trying to find a suitable diagnosis. You really earned this."
c-10: ^"What I do know is things haven't been easy, especially with your doctors still trying to find a suitable diagnosis. You really earned this."
c-11: ^"It hasn't been easy, especially with your doctors still trying to find a suitable diagnosis. But that's no excuse to be rude."

g-10: ^Your mother sighs, then turns her attention to the newspaper.
g-11: ^"I think I know what you really want to talk about, though."
g-12: ^"You promised, once I had my diploma."

c-15: ^"We did promise. Shall we look at the paper together?"
c-16: ^"You are indeed. You grew up so fast, too fast. But we did promise you."
c-17: ^"Come now. I know you're excited, but a little patience goes a long way. We did promise you, after all."

g-14: ^"Now, before we start looking, we did have a few ground rules. We'll cover your first month of rent, the security deposit, and any utility start-up costs, but the rest of the bills will be up to you."
g-15: ^"We can't forget to deposit the graduation money you got from your grandparents. That should be enough to get you started."
g-16: ^You can view your relationships with people and other information about them in your Contacts app.
g-17: ^You and your mother open the newspaper to the classifieds section while your father continues to quietly flip pancakes. He seems to have a subtle smile on his face.
g-18: ^What would you like to look at first?

c-0: ^You start skimming the apartment section and find the following options.
^The Basic City Apartment is located just inside the city limits in an older building. It's a bit rundown but the rent is only $600 a month. It comes already furnished.
^It's also close to the bus stop, and the convenience store you visited for the paper yesterday. The train station takes a bit of a walk, though.

g-5: ^"Sounds like you found a good place, huh
g-6: ^Instead of waiting for a reply, he continues talking. "Like your mother said, we'll be helping you with the initial costs. And I'll drive the moving van to get your stuff to your new home. We really are so proud of you."
g-7: ^"You better help out. You are my parents, after all."

c-9: ^"Of course, dear. You're very precious to us. Now eat up!"
c-10: ^"Of course, we'll do what we can. Because we love you, not because it's an expectation. "
c-11: ^"Haha. I bet all those calls were exhausting. Eat up."

g-10: ^You dig into the pancakes, excited for your new future.
g-11: ^You spend the rest of the morning discussing what your new job might be like, what stuff you'll want to bring with you, and overall, how happy you to be hitting this milestone in your life.
g-12: ^You lost 1 Energy from having a long conversation.
g-13: ^By the time it hits the afternoon, you're exhausted and ready for the day to be over.
g-14: ^Your parents look concerned but understanding when you say you're going to head to bed early. After all, you have the apartment showing tomorrow and the job interview the day after. Better rest up.
